context_bundle.summary: GraphQL API pattern: Query language for APIs, single endpoint (/graphql), client specifies exact fields needed, strongly typed schema (SDL), introspection for API discovery. Operations: query (read), mutation (write), subscription (real-time). Resolvers fetch data for each field. Benefits: No over-fetching (REST returns all fields), no under-fetching (one request vs multiple REST calls), strongly typed, self-documenting. Drawbacks: Complexity (caching harder than REST), N+1 problem (use DataLoader batching), query depth attacks (limit recursion). Tools: Apollo Server (Node.js), graphene (Python), Strawberry (Python async), graphql-java. Schema: type User { id: ID!, name: String!, posts: [Post!]! }; type Query { user(id: ID!): User }.

onboarding.quick_start: GraphQL basics: Schema (SDL): type Query { user(id: ID!): User posts(limit: Int): [Post] } type User { id: ID! name: String! email: String posts: [Post] } type Post { id: ID! title: String! author: User }. Query: query { user(id: "123") { name email posts { title } } } # Returns only requested fields. Python (Strawberry): import strawberry; @strawberry.type class User: name: str; email: str; @strawberry.type class Query: @strawberry.field def user(self, id: str) -> User: return db.get_user(id); schema = strawberry.Schema(query=Query). Node.js (Apollo Server): const typeDefs = gql`type Query { user(id: ID!): User }`; const resolvers = { Query: { user: (parent, args, context) => db.getUser(args.id) } }; const server = new ApolloServer({ typeDefs, resolvers }). Mutations: mutation { createUser(name: "Alice", email: "alice@ex.com") { id name } }. DataLoader (solve N+1): const userLoader = new DataLoader(ids => db.getUsersByIds(ids)); # Batches requests. Pagination: query { posts(first: 10, after: "cursor123") { edges { node { title } cursor } pageInfo { hasNextPage } } }.
common_patterns: GraphQL schema definition: type Query { users(limit: Int, offset: Int): [User!]! user(id: ID!): User } type Mutation { createUser(input: CreateUserInput!): User! updateUser(id: ID!, input: UpdateUserInput!): User! } input CreateUserInput { name: String! email: String! }
Python Strawberry resolver: @strawberry.field def posts(self, info, limit: int = 10) -> List[Post]: user_id = info.context['user_id']; return db.get_posts(user_id, limit)
Apollo Server DataLoader: const postLoader = new DataLoader(async (userIds) => { const posts = await db.getPostsByUserIds(userIds); return userIds.map(id => posts.filter(p => p.userId === id)); })
Nested queries: query { user(id: "1") { name posts { title comments { text author { name } } } } }
Fragments: fragment UserFields on User { id name email } query { user(id: "1") { ...UserFields posts { title } } }
Variables: query GetUser($userId: ID!) { user(id: $userId) { name } } # Variables: {"userId": "123"}
Subscriptions (real-time): subscription { postCreated { id title author { name } } } # WebSocket connection
Cursor pagination: query { posts(first: 10, after: $cursor) { edges { node { title } cursor } pageInfo { endCursor hasNextPage } } }
Query depth limiting: const depthLimit = require('graphql-depth-limit'); const server = new ApolloServer({ validationRules: [depthLimit(5)] })
Authorization: @strawberry.field(permission_classes=[IsAuthenticated]) def sensitive_data(self) -> str: return self.secret
